required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Meal Delivery and Exercise Intervention to Increase Resilience in Homebound Older Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a home-based exercise program administered through Meals on wheels (MOW) on gait speed and frailty status and to assess the association between novel serum biomarkers (70 kilodalton heat shock proteins (HSP70),Macrophage Inflammatory Proteins(MIP1b), soluble IL-6 receptor alpha-chain (sIL-6R)) and established but non-specific frailty biomarkers (Interleukin 6 (IL-6), C-reactive protein (CRP), Tumor necrosis factor (TNF-α)) in frail and prefrail homebound older adults before and after the exercise intervention.

primary_outcome.description: this is the time one takes to walk a specified distance on level surfaces over a short distance and is measured in meters/second

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total FFP score as assessed by the Fried Frailty Phenotype (FFP) screening test
Change in measure of HSP70 (ng/mL) expression
Change in Measure of MIP-1β (pg/mL) expression
Change in Measure of sIL-6R (pg/mL) expression

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in overall frailty status as assessed by the Fried Frailty Phenotype (FFP) screening test
secondary_outcome.description: The FFP defines frailty as having 3 or more characteristics of unintentional weight loss, fatigue, decreased physical activity, weakness, and slowness.Those who have 1 or 2 characteristics are considered pre frail, while those who have no characteristics are robust.

Grip strength is a measure of muscular strength or the maximum force/tension generated by one's forearm muscles .This is measured by using a dynamometer which will be squeezed by the participant 3 times in each hand.The force is measured in kilograms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily average steps from the activity tracker
Number of patients that required emergency room visits
Number of patients that required hospitalization
Change in activities of daily living as measured by the Katz Index of Independence in Activities of Daily Living
secondary_outcome.description: This consists of 6 questions and each is scored form 0(patient is very dependent)-6(patient is independent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in instrumental activities of daily living as measured by the LAWTON - BRODY INSTRUMENTAL ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING SCALE (I.A.D.L.)
secondary_outcome.description: This consists of 8 questions and each has a summary score range from 0 (low function, dependent) to 8 (high function, independent) for women and 0 through 5 for men to avoid potential gender bias.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in loneliness as assessed by the UCLA Loneliness Scale (ULS)
secondary_outcome.description: This questionnaire consists of 20 questions and each is answered from 1(never)-4(always) for a total score ranging form 20-80

secondary_outcome.measure: Social network as assessed by the LUBBEN SOCIAL NETWORK SCALE - 18 (LSNS-18)
secondary_outcome.description: LSNS-R total score is an equally weighted sum of twelve items. Scores range from 0 to 90, a higher number indicating a better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: change in measure of IL-6 (pg/mL) expression
Change in measures of CRP (ng/mL) expression
Change in measures of TNF-α (pg/mL) expression
change in IL-6 (pg/mL) as measured by the frailty status
change in CRP (ng/mL) as measured by the frailty status
change in TNF-α (pg/mL) as measured by the frailty status
change in HSP70 (ng/mL) as measured by the frailty status
change in MIP-1β (pg/mL) as measured by the frailty status
change in sIL-6R (pg/mL) as measured by the frailty status

intervention.description: Participants will receive 12 weeks of a MOW delivery service that will include 2 meals per day during the weekdays with 4 shelf-stable meals at the end of the week. The MOW driver will visit the participants in-person to ask a series of 5 questions about change in health status, joint/muscle injuries, new pain, falls, and poor appetite twice a week. Participants will also will receive an exercise kit from the MOW driver with their first meal delivery which will contain 2 tennis balls, 2 1-pound hand weights, and one towel. Every week, the driver will give the participants a handout containing 3 exercises from the NIA Go4Life Workout-to-Go book that are designed to help with strength/endurance, balance, and flexibility20. The participants will be asked to do the 3 exercises every day, if possible, on their own. Every 4 weeks during the 12-week study period and at 6 months follow up patients will have blood drawn for frailty and inflammatory biomarkers.

Participants will receive 12 weeks of a MOW delivery service that will include 2 meals per day during the weekdays with 4 shelf-stable meals at the end of the week. The MOW driver will visit the participants in-person to ask a series of 5 questions about change in health status, joint/muscle injuries, new pain, falls, and poor appetite twice a week. they will be asked to continue their usual level of activity.Every 4 weeks during the 12-week study period and at 6 months follow up patients will have blood drawn for frailty and inflammatory biomarkers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- enrolled in the UTHealth-Harris Health House Call Service (HCS)
- frail or prefrail by The Fried Frailty Phenotype (FFP)
- medically stable
Exclusion Criteria:
- robust by FFP
- have Mini-Cog score <3 and/or are unable to follow instructions
- have a pre-diagnosed terminal illness
- unable to ambulate
- unable to use their upper extremities, and/or are already participating in physician-prescribed physical therapy or occupational therapy.
